comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: There was a bewildering number of German firms who built their own version of the original design of the Austro-Hungarian Igo Etrich, most of them are not bothered by the patents held by Etrich. To identify all these different Taubes ('Doves') is a hell of a job, but some experts have come far, although not every variant has been identified. This pictures gives the D.F.W [Deutsche Flufzeugwerke] Stahltaube. ['Steel Dove']. References are in John A. de Vries. Taube, Dove of War and Peter M. Grosz. The Taube at War. Windsock Datafile No. 104
